answers.answer: Hello~Anxiety can cause all kinds of itching, so can allergies. Have you changed laundry detergents or bath soap? Have you been checked for diabetes, this can cause lots of itching as well. food allergies and environmental allergies can also cause the problem. I would see your doctor and ask for some blood tests to rule out any serious blood disorder, diabetes, etc. They should do an allergy panel, a CBC, and liver function tests, they probably will have others as well.

question: Does anyone have a clue about Julian1161's or GyptianGal's extreme itch questions?  It feels like an insect bite coming from inside or like a nerve firing.  It moves from one place to another for about 10 to 15 minutes.  I am unaware of a pattern or cause, other than I am under a good amount of stress.  I was awakened by such a progression last night, thus the question.  It also happens randomly, of course, not just at night.
title: RANDOM INTENSE ITCH WHEN I SCRATCH IT, 30 SECONDS LATER, IT MOVES. ANYBODY?
